methods.name: <
methods.documentation: a.< b returns True when a is lesser than b.
Integer addition.

methods.name: <em>
methods.documentation: Integer multiplication.
Integer equality. a.== b returns True when a equals b.
Integer subtraction.
a.> b returns True when a is greater than b.
Division remainder a.% b == a - (a / b) * b
Integral division – a./ b returns the largest integer c such that c * b <= a.

methods.name: pred
methods.documentation: Predecessor. a.pred == a - 1

methods.name: negate
methods.documentation: Integer negation. a.negate == -1 * a.

methods.name: toReal
methods.documentation: Promote an integer to a real number.

methods.name: toText
methods.documentation: Display an integer as text.

methods.name: shortRep
methods.documentation: Alias for toText, for the purpose of pretty printing the number.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.documentation: JSON representation of an integer.

methods.name: miliseconds
methods.documentation: Returns a TimeInterval with the length of self miliseconds.

methods.name: seconds
methods.documentation: Returns a TimeInterval with the length of self seconds.

methods.name: minutes
methods.documentation: Returns a TimeInterval with the length of self minutes.

methods.name: hours
methods.documentation: Returns a TimeInterval with the length of self hours.

methods.name: days
methods.documentation: Returns a TimeInterval with the length of self days.

methods.name: weeks
methods.documentation: Returns a TimeInterval with the length of self weeks.

methods.name: succ
methods.documentation: Successor. a.succ == a + 1

methods.name: upto
methods.documentation: Generates a list representing a range. a.upto b == [a, a + 1, a + 2, ..., b - 1, b]

classes.name: Int
classes.documentation: Class representing integer numbers of arbitrary size.

methods.name: <
methods.documentation: Tests whether self is lesser than the argument.
Floating point addition.
Floating point multiplication.
Floating point exponentiation.
Tests whether self is equal to the argument.
Floating point subtraction.
Tests whether self is greater than the argument.
Floating point division.

methods.name: negate
methods.documentation: Negation. a.negate == -1.0 * a

methods.name: toText
methods.documentation: Display a real number as text.

methods.name: shortRep
methods.documentation: Displays a number as text.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.documentation: Converts a number to JSON.

methods.name: log
methods.documentation: Floating point logarithm with given basis.

methods.name: round
methods.documentation: Round a number with given precision – the result is a real number with the number of digits after the decimal dot equal to the argument.

methods.name: floor
methods.documentation: Round a number down to the closest Int

methods.name: ceiling
methods.documentation: Round a number up to the closest Int

methods.documentation: Hyperbolic cosine function.

methods.documentation: Hyperbolic tangent function.

methods.name: acos
methods.documentation: Inverse cosine function.

methods.name: atan
methods.documentation: Inverse tangent function.

methods.name: asinh
methods.documentation: Inverse hyperbolic sine function.

methods.name: acosh
methods.documentation: Inverse hyperbolic cosine function.

methods.name: atanh
methods.documentation: Inverse hyperbolic tangent function.

methods.name: exp
methods.documentation: Natural exponential function.

methods.name: ln
methods.documentation: Natural logarithm function.

methods.name: sqrt
methods.documentation: Square root.

classes.name: Real
classes.documentation: Class representing floating point numbers.

methods.name: <
methods.documentation: Tests whether self is lesser than the argument in lexicographical order.
Concatenates two texts together.
Tests wheter two texts are equal.
Tests whether self is greater than the argument in lexicographical order.

methods.name: toInt
methods.documentation: Reinterprets the string as an integer in decimal system. Throws an error when the text does not represent a valid integer.

methods.name: toReal
methods.documentation: Reinterprets the string as a real number in decimal system. Throws an error when the text does not represent a valid real number.

methods.name: toText
methods.documentation: Identity function, included for consistency with other types.

methods.name: shortRep
methods.documentation: Truncates the text for optimal display in interactive mode.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.documentation: Converts the text to JSON.

methods.name: isEmpty
methods.documentation: Tests whether the text is empty (equal to "").

methods.name: length
methods.documentation: Measures the text length.

methods.name: startsWith
methods.documentation: Tests whether the argument is a prefix of self.

methods.name: isPrefixOf
methods.documentation: Tests whether self is a prefix of the argument.

methods.name: endsWith
methods.documentation: Tests whether the argument is a suffix of self.

methods.name: isSuffixOf
methods.documentation: Tests whether self is a suffix of the argument.

methods.name: characters
methods.documentation: Returns a list of all characters in the text.

methods.name: words
methods.documentation: Returns a list of all words (white-space delimited) in the text.

methods.name: lines
methods.documentation: Returns a list of all lines (newline delimited) in the text.

methods.name: lowercase
methods.documentation: Changes all characters to lowercase.

methods.name: uppercase
methods.documentation: Changes all characters to uppercase.

methods.name: reverse
methods.documentation: Reverses the text.

methods.name: toBinary
methods.documentation: Convert the text to bare binary data.

methods.name: safeToInt
methods.documentation: Tries to reinterpret the string as an integer in decimal system. Returns Nothing when the text does not represent a valid integer.

methods.name: safeToReal
methods.documentation: Tries to reinterpret the string as a real number in decimal system. Returns Nothing when the text does not represent a valid real number.

classes.name: Text
classes.documentation: The basic class for representing Texts.

methods.documentation: Concatenates two pieces of binary data together.
Checks whether two pieces of data are equal.

methods.name: toText
methods.documentation: Encodes the binary object as an UTF-8 Text. Throws an error when the data does not represent a valid text.

methods.name: shortRep
methods.documentation: Displays a short representation of Binary object for use in interactive mode.

methods.name: length
methods.documentation: Measures the length in bytes of binary object.

methods.name: toBinary
methods.documentation: Identity function, included for consistency with other classes.

methods.name: take
methods.documentation: Returns a prefix consisting of the given number of bytes.

methods.name: drop
methods.documentation: Returns a suffix resulting from dropping the given number of bytes at the beginning.

classes.name: Binary
classes.documentation: Class for representing arbitrary binary data. Does not attempt to interpret the data in any way.

methods.documentation: Complex number addition.

methods.name: <em>
methods.documentation: Complex number multiplication.

methods.name: toText
methods.documentation: Displays a complex number as text.

methods.documentation: Displays a complex number as text.

methods.name: modulus
methods.documentation: Complex number modulus.

methods.name: real
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: imaginary
methods.documentation: Field getter.

classes.name: Complex
classes.documentation: Class representing complex numbers over Real numbers.

methods.documentation: Equality of booleans, semantically the same as logical equivalence.

methods.name: toText
methods.documentation: Represents logical values as Text.

methods.name: shortRep
methods.documentation: Represents logical values as Text.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.documentation: Converts a boolean value to JSON.

methods.name: and
methods.documentation: Boolean and.

methods.name: or
methods.documentation: Boolean or.

methods.name: not
methods.documentation: Logical negation.

classes.documentation: Class representing boolean values

methods.documentation: Represents a None value as Text.

methods.name: shortRep
methods.documentation: Represents a None value as Text.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.documentation: Converts a None value into JSON.

classes.name: None
classes.documentation: Class representing the lack of interesting value. Mostly used for actions executed solely for their side effects, without any interesting return value.

methods.documentation: Tuple equality. Two tuples are equal when their respective elements are equal.

methods.name: toText
methods.documentation: Text representation of a tuple.

methods.name: shortRep
methods.documentation: Short Text representation of a pair.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.documentation: Converts a pair into a JSON object.

methods.name: first
methods.documentation: Plucks the first element of a tuple.

methods.name: second
methods.documentation: Plucks the second element of a tuple.

methods.name: map
methods.documentation: Maps a function over both elements of a tuple.

classes.name: Tuple2
classes.documentation: Class representing pairs of elements of arbitrary type.

methods.documentation: Triple equality. Two triples are equal when their respective elements are equal.

methods.name: toText
methods.documentation: Text representation of a triple.

methods.name: shortRep
methods.documentation: Short Text representation of a triple.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.documentation: Converts a triple into a JSON object.

methods.name: first
methods.documentation: Plucks the first element of a triple.

methods.name: second
methods.documentation: Plucks the second element of a triple.

methods.name: map
methods.documentation: Maps a function over all elements of a triple.

methods.name: third
methods.documentation: Plucks the third element of a triple.

classes.name: Tuple3
classes.documentation: Class representing triples of elements of arbitrary type.

methods.documentation: 4-tuple equality. Two 4-tuples are equal when their respective elements are equal.

methods.name: toText
methods.documentation: Text representation of a 4-tuple.

methods.name: shortRep
methods.documentation: Short text representation of a 4-tuple.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.documentation: Converts a 4-tuple to a JSON object.

methods.name: first
methods.documentation: Plucks the first element of a 4-tuple.

methods.name: second
methods.documentation: Plucks the second element of a 4-tuple.

methods.name: map
methods.documentation: Maps a function over all elements of a 4-tuple.

methods.name: third
methods.documentation: Plucks the third element of a 4-tuple.

methods.name: fourth
methods.documentation: Plucks the fourth element of a 4-tuple.

classes.name: Tuple4
classes.documentation: Class representing 4-tuples of elements of arbitrary type.

methods.documentation: Checks the equality of two Maybe values. Returns True when both values are Nothing or when they are Just and the values inside are equal.

methods.name: toText
methods.documentation: Text representation of a Maybe object.

methods.name: shortRep
methods.documentation: Short text representation of a Maybe object.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.documentation: Converts a Maybe object to JSON.

methods.name: map
methods.documentation: Takes a function f and returns Just (f a) when called on Just a and Nothing otherwise.

methods.name: toList
methods.documentation: Cast a Maybe value into a List. Returns an empty list when the value is missing and a singleton list otherwise.

methods.name: get
methods.documentation: Returns the value when called on Just, throws an error otherwise.

methods.name: withDefault
methods.documentation: Returns the value when called on Just or the provided default value when called on a Nothing.

methods.name: isJust
methods.documentation: Returns True when called on a Just and False otherwise.

methods.name: isNothing
methods.documentation: Returns True when called on a Nothing and False otherwise.

methods.name: flatMap
methods.documentation: Takes a function returning Maybe, maps it over self and flattens the result.

methods.name: each
methods.documentation: A variant of map that executes any effects performed by the function.

methods.name: flatten
methods.documentation: Flattens nested Maybe values. Returns Just a when called on Just (Just a) and Nothing otherwise.

classes.name: Maybe
classes.documentation: The basic optional type in Luna. The value of this class can either be a Nothing (representing the lack of value) or a Just value (in the case value is present). This is a type-safe substitute for nullable values known from other languages.

methods.documentation: Checks whether two Either values are equal. Returns True when both values are Left or both are Right and when the contained values are equal.

methods.name: left
methods.documentation: Returns a when called on a Left a, throws an error otherwise.

methods.name: right
methods.documentation: Returns a when called on a Right a, throws an error otherwise.

methods.name: toText
methods.documentation: Text representation of an Either value.

methods.name: shortRep
methods.documentation: Short text representation of an Either value.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.documentation: Converts an Either value into a JSON object.

methods.name: map
methods.documentation: Runs the provided function on a Right value and returns Left values unchanged. a.map f is the same as a.either id f.

methods.name: flatMap
methods.documentation: Takes a function returning an Either and runs it when run on a Right. Returns the Left value unchangeds.

methods.name: either
methods.documentation: Takes two functions returning the same type, calls the first when called on Left and the second for Right.

methods.name: toMaybe
methods.documentation: Convert an Either a b into a Maybe by turning a Left into Nothing (thus forgetting the value in this case) and a Right a into Just a.

methods.name: isLeft
methods.documentation: Checks whether the value is Left a.

methods.name: isRight
methods.documentation: Checks whether the value is Right a.

classes.name: Either
classes.documentation: Either represents an alternative of two different values – either one or the other is present.

methods.documentation: List concatenation.
List equality. Two lists are equal when they have the same length and their respective elements are equal.

methods.name: head
methods.documentation: Returns Just the first element when the list is not empty, Nothing otherwise.

methods.name: toText
methods.documentation: Text represenation of a list.

methods.name: shortRep
methods.documentation: Short text representation of a list.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.documentation: Converts a list to a JSON object.

methods.name: isEmpty
methods.documentation: Tests whether the list is empty.

methods.name: length
methods.documentation: Computes the length of a list.

methods.name: reverse
methods.documentation: Reverses the list.

methods.name: take
methods.documentation: Returns the list prefix of a given length or the whole list, when the requested prefix is longer than the list.

methods.name: drop
methods.documentation: Returns the list without the prefix of a requested length, or an empty list if the number of dropped elements is larger than the list length.

methods.name: map
methods.documentation: Maps a function over each element of the list.

methods.name: flatMap
methods.documentation: Maps a list-returning function over each element and concatenates the results.

methods.name: each
methods.documentation: Maps a function over each element of the list, immediately executing all side effects and returning a list of results.

methods.name: tail
methods.documentation: Returns Just the list without the first element when the list is not empty, Nothing otherwise.

methods.name: prepend
methods.documentation: Prepends an element to the list.

methods.name: sequence
methods.documentation: Executes the actions from each element of the list.

methods.name: at
methods.documentation: Returns Just the element at a given position in the list. Returns Nothing when the index does not exist.

methods.name: getAt
methods.documentation: Returns the element at a given position in the list. Throws an error when the index does not exist.

methods.name: fold
methods.documentation: Takes an initial value and a function. Returns the result of repeatedly calling the function on the next list element and the current accumulator.

methods.name: foldLeft
methods.documentation: Takes an initial value and a function. Returns the result of repeatedly calling the function on the next list element and the current accumulator.

methods.name: prependAll
methods.documentation: Private.

methods.name: intersperse
methods.documentation: Inserts an element between every two elements of a list.

methods.name: filter
methods.documentation: Returns a list of all the elements for which the given predicate returns True.

methods.name: _merge
methods.documentation: Private.

methods.name: sortBy
methods.documentation: Sorts the list in an increasing order by the results of the given function.

methods.name: _chunkBy
methods.documentation: Private.

methods.name: chunkBy
methods.documentation: Chunks the list into lists of consecutive values returning the same value of a given function. For example: [1, 2, 3, 4, 2, 2].chunkBy (> 2) # => [(False, [1, 2]), (True, [3, 4]), (False, [2, 2])]

methods.name: groupBy
methods.documentation: Groups the list into lists of values returning the same value of a given function. Requires the return value of the function to be ordered. For example: [1, 2, 3, 4, 2, 2].chunkBy (> 2) # => [(False, [1, 2, 2, 2]), (True, [3, 4])]

methods.name: sort
methods.documentation: Sorts the list in an increasing order.

methods.name: _prefixes
methods.documentation: Private.

methods.name: prefixes
methods.documentation: Returns a list of all prefixes of the given list.

methods.name: zipWith
methods.documentation: Returns a list resulting from combining respective elements of two lists with the provided function. The length of the result is the length of the shorter of the lists.

methods.name: zip
methods.documentation: Returns a list of pairs of respective elements of two lists. The length of the result is the length of the shorter of the lists.

methods.name: _all
methods.documentation: Checks whether all elements of a list satisfy a provided predicate.

methods.name: _any
methods.documentation: Checks whether any element of a list satisfies a provided predicate.

methods.name: collect
methods.documentation: Takes a list of Maybes and returns a list of all the Just elements.

methods.name: makeText
methods.documentation: Converts a list into text by converting each element to text and concatenating them using the provided separator.

methods.name: concat
methods.documentation: Takes a list of lists and concatenates them into a single list.

methods.name: contains
methods.documentation: Checks whether the list contains a given element.

methods.name: takeWhile
methods.documentation: Returns the longest prefix of the list for which a given predicate is satisfied.

classes.name: List
classes.documentation: Lists of arbitrary length, consisting of elements of the same type.

methods.documentation: Map equality. Two maps are equal when they contain the same keys and the elements associated with each key are equal.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.documentation: Converts a map with Text keys to JSON.

methods.name: isEmpty
methods.documentation: Tests whether the map is empty.

methods.name: map
methods.documentation: Applies a function to each value in the map.

methods.name: toList
methods.documentation: Converts the map into a list of (key, value) pairs.

methods.name: get
methods.documentation: Gets an element for a given key. Throws an exception when the key is not present in the Map.

methods.name: empty
methods.documentation: Returns an empty map.

methods.name: singleton
methods.documentation: Returns a map with a single element.

methods.name: size
methods.documentation: Returns the number of values stored in the map.

methods.name: lookup
methods.documentation: Looks up an element for a given key.

methods.name: insert
methods.documentation: Inserts an element at a given key.

methods.name: delete
methods.documentation: Deletes a key from the given map. If the the key is missing, it returns the original map.

classes.name: Map
classes.documentation: Represents a dictionary from keys of given type to values of given type. The keys need to have ordering defined.

methods.name: coefficient
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: exponent
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: toText
methods.documentation: Dumps a JSON structure into a Text object.

methods.name: shortRep
methods.documentation: Short text representation for a JSON object.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.documentation: Identity. Included for consistency with other classes.

methods.name: get
methods.documentation: Returns the value associated with a given key. Throws an error when the JSON is not an object or the key is missing.

methods.name: at
methods.documentation: Returns Just the element with a given index assuming the JSON represents an array and the index is in range. Returns Nothing otherwise.

methods.name: getAt
methods.documentation: Returns the element with a given index assuming the JSON represents an array and the index is in range. Throws an error otherwise.

methods.name: empty
methods.documentation: Returns an empty JSON object

methods.name: lookup
methods.documentation: Returns Just the value associated with a given key. Returns Nothing when the JSON is not an object or when the key is missing.

methods.name: insert
methods.documentation: Inserts a value for a given key into the JSON object. Throws an exception when the JSON does not represent an object.

methods.name: delete
methods.documentation: Deletes a value for a given key from the JSON object. Does nothing when the JSON does not represent an object or does not contain the key.

methods.name: safeParse
methods.documentation: Parses a Text into a JSON object. Returns Left containing error message when the Text does not contain a valid JSON object.

methods.name: parse
methods.documentation: Parses a Text into a JSON object. Throws an error when the Text does not contain a valid JSON object.

methods.name: render
methods.documentation: Dumps a JSON structure into a Text object.

methods.name: asObject
methods.documentation: Returns a Map from Text to JSON, assuming the JSON represents an object. Throws an error otherwise.

methods.name: asText
methods.documentation: Returns a Text assuming the JSON represents text. Throws an error otherwise.

methods.name: asReal
methods.documentation: Returns a Real assuming the JSON represents a number. Throws an error otherwise.

methods.name: asInt
methods.documentation: Returns an Int assuming the JSON represents a number and it didn't contain a decimal point. Throws an error otherwise.

methods.name: asBool
methods.documentation: Returns a Bool assuming the JSON represents a boolean. Throws an error otherwise.

methods.name: asList
methods.documentation: Returns a list of JSON object assuming the JSON represents an array. Throws an error otherwise.

methods.name: safeAsObject
methods.documentation: Returns Just a Map from Text to JSON, assuming the JSON represents an object. Returns Nothing otherwise.

methods.name: safeAsText
methods.documentation: Returns Just a Text assuming the JSON represents text. Returns Nothing otherwise.

methods.name: safeAsReal
methods.documentation: Returns Just a Real assuming the JSON represents a number. Returns Nothing otherwise.

methods.name: safeAsInt
methods.documentation: Returns Just an Int assuming the JSON represents a number and it didn't contain a decimal point. Returns Nothing otherwise.

methods.name: safeAsBool
methods.documentation: Returns Just a Bool assuming the JSON represents a boolean. Returns Nothing otherwise.

methods.name: safeAsList
methods.documentation: Returns Just a list of JSON object assuming the JSON represents an array. Returns Nothing otherwise.

methods.name: getObject
methods.documentation: Gets a Map from Text to JSON associated with a given key. Throws an error when the JSON is not an object, the key is not present or the associated value is not an object.

methods.name: getText
methods.documentation: Gets a Text associated with a given key. Throws an error when the JSON is not an object, the key is not present or the associated value is not a text.

methods.name: getReal
methods.documentation: Gets a Real associated with a given key. Throws an error when the JSON is not an object, the key is not present or the associated value is not a number.

methods.name: getInt
methods.documentation: Gets an Int associated with a given key. Throws an error when the JSON is not an object, the key is not present or the associated value is not an integer.

methods.name: getBool
methods.documentation: Gets a Bool associated with a given key. Throws an error when the JSON is not an object, the key is not present or the associated value is not a boolean.

methods.name: getList
methods.documentation: Gets a List of JSON values associated with a given key. Throws an error when the JSON is not an object, the key is not present or the associated value is not an array.

methods.name: lookupObject
methods.documentation: Looks up a Map from Text to JSON associated with a given key. Returns Nothing when the JSON is not an object, the key is not present or the associated value is not an object.

methods.name: lookupText
methods.documentation: Looks up a Text associated with a given key. Returns Nothing when the JSON is not an object, the key is not present or the associated value is not a text.

methods.name: lookupReal
methods.documentation: Looks up a Real associated with a given key. Returns Nothing when the JSON is not an object, the key is not present or the associated value is not a number.

methods.name: lookupInt
methods.documentation: Looks up an Int associated with a given key. Returns Nothing when the JSON is not an object, the key is not present or the associated value is not an integer.

methods.name: lookupBool
methods.documentation: Looks up a Bool associated with a given key. Returns Nothing when the JSON is not an object, the key is not present or the associated value is not a boolean.

methods.name: lookupList
methods.documentation: Looks up a List of JSON values associated with a given key. Returns Nothing when the JSON is not an object, the key is not present or the associated value is not an array.

classes.name: JSON
classes.documentation: Class representing JSON objects.

methods.name: take
methods.documentation: Takes the value out of the MVar and returns it, leaving the MVar empty. Calling this on an empty MVar suspends the thread until the value is put in it.

methods.name: read
methods.documentation: Takes the value out of the MVar and returns it, leaving the original value in the MVar. Calling this on an empty MVar suspends the thread until the value is put in it.

methods.name: put
methods.documentation: Puts a value inside the MVar. Calling this method on a non-empty MVar suspends the thread until the old value is taken out.

classes.name: MVar
classes.documentation: MVar is a mutable variable, safe to read and modify in a multi-threaded environment. An MVar can either be empty or can contain a value. Reading an empty MVar locks the thread until a value is written. Writing to a non-empty MVar locks the thread until a value is taken out.

methods.name: head
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: take
methods.documentation: Returns the prefix of the stream of given length.

methods.name: drop
methods.documentation: Drops the given number of elements from the stream.

methods.name: map
methods.documentation: Runs a function on each element on the stream, not executing any side effects.

methods.name: each
methods.documentation: Runs a function on each element of the stream, immediately executing all side effects. Due to the stream being infinite, this function never terminates.

methods.name: tail
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: fold
methods.documentation: Takes a function and returns a stream resulting from calling the function repeatedly on the next element of the stream and the previously accumulated value, where the first accumulated value is the first element in the stream.

methods.name: collect
methods.documentation: Transforms a stream containing Maybe values into one containing only the Just items.

methods.name: takeWhile
methods.documentation: Returns the longest prefix of stream in which all elements satisfy the given predicate.

methods.name: foldFrom
methods.documentation: Takes an initial value and function. Returns a stream resulting from calling the function repeatedly on the next element of the stream and the previously accumulated value.

methods.name: consume
methods.documentation: s.consume n returns a list of the first n elements of s and the result of dropping the first n values of s.

methods.name: consumeWhile
methods.documentation: Returns the longest prefix in which all elements satisfy the given predicate, and the result of dropping this prefix from the original stream.

methods.name: dropWhile
methods.documentation: Drops the longest prefix of stream in which all elements satisfy the given predicate.

methods.name: eval
methods.documentation: Evaluates all actions associated with stream elements sequentially. Due to the stream being infinite, this function never terminates.

methods.name: rateLimit
methods.documentation: Returns a stream containing the same values as the original stream, but produces them no more often than the given time interval.

classes.name: Stream
classes.documentation: Stream represents an infinite data source, with a list-like API.

functions.documentation: Greater or equal operator. Requires the objects to define both > and == methods.

functions.name: <=
functions.documentation: Less than or equal to operator. Requires the objects to define both < and == methods.

functions.name: if_then_else
functions.documentation: The basic conditional operator. if a then b else c is b when a is True and c otherwise.

functions.name: switch
functions.documentation: Alias for the if then else construction, looks better with currying.

functions.name: throw
functions.documentation: Takes a Text and throws it as an error.

functions.name: id
functions.documentation: Identity function. id a is the same as a for any a.

functions.name: everyWithState
functions.documentation: A variant of every in which the action modifies some local state while running.

functions.name: newMVar
functions.documentation: Creates an empty MVar object. MVar is a mutable variable, safe to read and modify in a multi-threaded environment. An MVar can either be empty or can contain a value. Reading an empty MVar suspends the thread until a value is written. Writing to a non-empty MVar suspends the thread until a value is taken out.

functions.name: fork
functions.documentation: Takes an action and executes it in a separate thread.

functions.name: streamFrom
functions.documentation: Builds a stream by repeatedly calling an action. Useful for consuming low-level streaming data sources.

functions.name: repeatWhile
functions.documentation: Repeat an action while predicate returns True. Returns a List of all the values for which predicate returned True.

functions.name: delayAsync
functions.documentation: Executes an action in a separate thread, after waiting the specified time interval.

functions.name: every
functions.documentation: Takes an action and a TimeInterval. Evaluates the action in given intervals, returning a Stream of consecutive values. Particularly useful for polling webservices or scheduling tasks.

functions.name: pi
functions.documentation: The mathematical constant π = 3.14159265359.

functions.name: const
functions.documentation: Constant function. Ignores its second argument and always returns the first.

functions.name: when
functions.documentation: Takes an action and evaluates it only when a given condition is met. Always returns None.

functions.name: unless
functions.documentation: Takes an action returning None and evaluating the action only unless a given condition is met.

functions.name: print
functions.documentation: Print the value to standard output. Can be called on any value which defines a toText method returning Text.

functions.name: readFile
functions.documentation: Read file from the hard drive, returning a Text value.

functions.name: writeFile
functions.documentation: Write a Text object into a file with a given path.

functions.name: catch
functions.documentation: Takes a value and a function from Text to value. Returns the value if it was correct or calls the function if the value was erroneous.

methods.name: properties
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: geometry
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: features
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: transformation
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: definition
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: x
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: y
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: point
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: leftHandle
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: rightHandle
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: a
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: b
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: c
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: d
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: tx
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: ty
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: type
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: operands
methods.documentation: Field getter.

classes.name: HttpMethod
classes.documentation: A class representing Http request method

methods.name: addValue
methods.documentation: Adds one pair to the body. Returns an HttpSimpleBody with the new additional pair

methods.name: values
methods.documentation: Field getter.

classes.name: HttpSimpleBody
classes.documentation: Helper class for passing parameters in the body of an Http request

methods.name: json
methods.documentation: Body of a response converted to JSON.

methods.name: stream
methods.documentation: Returns the body of the response as a stream. Even though it can be used with any response, it is most useful when combined with an inherently "streamy" data source, for example responses from the Twitter Stream API. See the Std.Base module's Stream class for information on on working with streams of data in Luna.

methods.name: headers
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: body
methods.documentation: The body of the response as a Binary blob.

methods.name: successful
methods.documentation:
Tells us whether the response came back yielding a successful result.
 We assume that response is successful when its code is one of: 200, 201, 202.

methods.name: text
methods.documentation: Body of the response converted to Text.

methods.name: responseCode
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: getChunk
methods.documentation: Field getter.

classes.name: HttpResponse
classes.documentation:
Response of an Http request, allows for different methods
 of accessing the body contents, see the methods.

methods.name: uri
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: headers
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: auth
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: oauth1
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: params
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: body
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: method
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: setMethod
methods.documentation: Sets the method of this HttpReuqest to a given HttpMethod.

methods.name: setBody
methods.documentation: Sets the body of a request. Can be called with anything that supports a toBinary method, including Text, Binary, JSON and HttpSimpleBody instances.

methods.name: addHeader
methods.documentation: Set the header (key) to a value (val). The header needs to be a valid Http header name, like Accept-Charset (but the case does not matter).

methods.name: setBasicAuth
methods.documentation: Use the provided username and password as HttpBasicAuth.

methods.name: setParam
methods.documentation: Append given key and value to the request params. Note: for params passed as the request body, consider using HttpSimpleBody helper class.

methods.name: setOAuth1
methods.documentation: Construct OAuth1 authentication headers using the provided OAuth1Data object. For a more detailed description of OAuth, please consult Std.OAuth.

methods.name: setOAuth2
methods.documentation: Set the OAuth2 authorization token. Note that this assumes that the caller already is in possesion of such a token, which can be obtained, among other ways, by using the OAuth2 class from Std.OAuth. For a more detailed description of OAuth, please consult Std.OAuth.

methods.name: perform
methods.documentation: Given a fully constructed HttpRequest object, this method actually performs the request. Note: no data will actually be sent until this method is called.

classes.name: HttpRequest
classes.documentation: A class representing an Http request. Even though it is possible to construct members of this class by hand, the idiomatic way of making the requests uses the helper class Http. Please consult the documentation below. This class provides a couple of setters to manipulate the default requests created by Http methods.

methods.name: head
methods.documentation: Create a basic Http HEAD request for a given uri.

methods.name: get
methods.documentation: Create a basic Http GET request for a given uri.

methods.name: delete
methods.documentation: Create an Http DELETE request for a given url.

methods.name: put
methods.documentation: Create an Http PUT request for a given uri and body. The body can be anything that provides a toBinary method, including the Text, Binary, JSON and HttpSimpleBody types.

methods.name: post
methods.documentation: Create an Http POST request for a given uri and body. The body can be anything that provides a toBinary method, including the Text, Binary, JSON and HttpSimpleBody types.

methods.name: patch
methods.documentation: Create an Http PATCH request for a given uri and body. The body can be anything that provides a toBinary method, including the Text, Binary, JSON and HttpSimpleBody types.

methods.name: connect
methods.documentation: Create a basic Http CONNECT request for a given uri.

methods.name: trace
methods.documentation: Create a basic Http TRACE request for a given uri.

methods.name: options
methods.documentation: Create an Http OPTIONS request for a given url.

methods.name: getBinary
methods.documentation: A helper method that immediately gets a binary blob from a given url. There is no need to call perform here, as it returns a Binary response.

methods.name: getJSON
methods.documentation: A helper method that immediately gets a JSON response from a given url. There is no need to call perform here, as it returns a JSON response.

classes.name: Http
classes.documentation: The main class for issuing Http requests. Provides methods for the most common request methods. The basic usage is the following: resp = Http.get "http://someurl.com/" . perform When you want to customize the way the requests are made, you can use the setters provided by the HttpRequest class in the following way: resp = Http.post "http://someurl.com/" . setHeader "Accept" "*" . setBasicAuth "user" "pass" . setParam "someParam" "someValue" . perform Note: the get, post, put and delete methods need to be followed by a perform invocation to actually make the request. Once we obtain the response object (resp in the examples above), we can use the methods of the HttpResponse class to process it, meaning in the examples above you can later call resp.stream or resp.body.

functions.name: defaultHttpRequest
functions.documentation: A helper function constructing a default HttpRequest, intended for internal use by the Http class. It is actually equivalent to Http.get.

functions.name: emptyHttpBody
functions.documentation: Conveniently creates an empty HttpSimpleBody

methods.name: clientKey
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: clientSecret
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: oauthToken
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: oauthTokenSecret
methods.documentation: Field getter.

classes.name: OAuth1Data
classes.documentation: A class encapsulating all the necessary OAuth1 data. That means: a clientKey, a clientSecret, an oauthToken and oauthTokenSecret. It can be passed directly to HttpResponse.setOAuth1 method, resulting in the following usage: oauthData = OAuth1Data someClientKey someClientSecret someOAuthToken someOAuthTokenSecret resp = Http.get "http://someurl.com/" . setOAuth1 oauthData . perform # process the response...

methods.name: clientSecret
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: clientId
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: accessTokenEndpoint
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: invalidateTokenEndpoint
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: callback
methods.documentation: Field getter.

classes.name: OAuth2Data
classes.documentation: A class encapsulating all the necessary OAuth2 data. That means: a clientId, a clientSecret, an accessTokenEndpoint, an invalidateTokenEndpoint and an optional callback url.

methods.name: postRequest
methods.documentation: A helper method for issuing OAuth2-related requests.

methods.name: fetchAccessToken
methods.documentation: Fetches the authorization token using the provided OAuth2Data object.

methods.name: invalidateToken
methods.documentation: Invalidates a token when it is no longer needed.

classes.name: OAuth2
classes.documentation: A class used for obtaining the OAuth2 authorization token. Given the necessary OAuth1Data it will issue a call to the accessTokenEndpoint and fetch the token. When the token is no longer needed it can be invalidated with a call to invalidateToken. An example flow is the following: oauthData = OAuth1Data someClientId someClientSecret someOAuthToken someOAuthTokenSecret token = OAuth2.fetchAccessToken oauthData resp = Http.get "http://someurl.com/" . setOAuth2 token . perform ## process the response... OAuth2.invalidateToken oauthData token For a more in-depth description of the OAuth2 flow, please see https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/an-introduction-to-oauth-2

classes.name: PipeRequest
classes.documentation: Data type representing different ways of connecting the processes outputs (e.g. stdout). Inherit means that the process gets a given pipe after the process that created it. UseHandle lets you specify a file to connect to the process instead of, for example, stdout. CreatePipe creates a fresh connection (pipe) that you can later use to communicate with the process. NoStream leaves a given pipe closed (e.g. if you don't need the processes stdin).

classes.name: BufferMode
classes.documentation: Data type used for specifying the buffering mode of the input-output operations.

methods.name: setBuffering
methods.documentation: Lets you specify the BufferMode for this file.

methods.name: isOpen
methods.documentation: Checks whether the file this handle is referring to is open.

methods.name: isClosed
methods.documentation: Checks whether the file this handle is referring to is closed.

methods.name: close
methods.documentation: Closes the file.

methods.name: flush
methods.documentation: Flushes any buffered content to make sure that it actually goes through.

methods.name: getContents
methods.documentation: Return the contents of the file.

methods.name: getLine
methods.documentation: Get one line of the file.

methods.name: putText
methods.documentation: Write some Text to the file.

methods.name: putLine
methods.documentation: Write some Text to the file, appending a new line at the end.

methods.name: toStream
methods.documentation: Access this file's contents as a Stream. For more information on dealing with streams in Luna please consult the Stream class documentation for Std.Base.

classes.name: FileHandle
classes.documentation: A class representing a file in the filesytstem.

methods.name: wait
methods.documentation: Wait for the process described by this handle to finish.

classes.name: ProcessHandle
classes.documentation: A class representing the low-level handle to the process in the operating system. Note that this class is used internally by Std.System and most users should use Process instead.

methods.name: stdin
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: stdout
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: stderr
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: wait
methods.documentation: Wait for this process to finish execution.

methods.name: handle
methods.documentation: Field getter.

classes.name: Process
classes.documentation: A class representing an operating system process. It allows you to access the standard input (stdin), the standard output (stdout) and standard error (stderr) of this process, hence allowing other processes to communicate with this one. It also exposes the wait method.

methods.name: args
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: stdin
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: stdout
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: stderr
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: command
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: setCommand
methods.documentation: Set the command to run. In general, calls to this method should be avoided, as the command is best passed to the Command.create call.

methods.name: setArgs
methods.documentation: Set the arguments to the process. In general, calls to this method should be avoided, as the arguments are best passed to the Command.create call.

methods.name: setStdin
methods.documentation: Set the standard input of the process to a specified PipeRequest.

methods.name: setStdout
methods.documentation: Set the standard output of the process to a specified PipeRequest.

methods.name: setStderr
methods.documentation: Set the standard error of the process to a specified PipeRequest.

methods.name: run
methods.documentation: Actually run this process, returning a Process instance.

methods.name: runWithInput
methods.documentation: Run this process with specified input.

methods.name: runWithStream
methods.documentation: Run this process, passing a stream as its input.

methods.name: execute
methods.documentation: Execute this process from beginning to end, returning its standard output, standard error and exit code instead of the Process object.

classes.name: ProcessDescription
classes.documentation: An object representing a process to launch (as opposed to Process, which is an already running process). Note: in most cases the constructor for this class should not be called directly. It is advisable to use Command.create instead. Please see the documentation for Command. This class provides a set of setters for changing the arguments to the process or changing its input and outputs. A ProcessDescription class will transform into a running Process once its run method is called.

methods.name: create
methods.documentation: Create the command to be run.

classes.name: Command
classes.documentation: The entry point to creating new processes and running system commands. It facilitates easy creation of processes by passing the command to run and its arguments. Once you call Command.create <cmd> <args>, you can modify it using the ProcessDescription methods like setStdin. Then, you need to call run (or one of its variants) to actually execute the process. Example of redirecting the output of ls -al to a file: cmd = Command.create "ls" ["-al"] . setStdout (UseHandle somefile) cmd.run

methods.name: exitSuccess
methods.documentation: Is this code a successful one?

methods.name: exitFailure
methods.documentation: Is this code not a successful one?

classes.name: ExitCode
classes.documentation: Exit code of a process. Can either be ExitSuccess or ExitFailure, in which case it will additionally contain the exit code.

methods.name: body
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: errorMessage
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: negatedErrorMessage
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: subject
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: <
methods.documentation: Is this Time earlier than the other?
Does this and the other Time point to the same time?
Is this Time later than the other?

methods.name: toText
methods.documentation: Converts a Time to Text using the default format (YYYY-MM-DD.HH:MM:SS).

methods.name: safeParse
methods.documentation: Try to parse Time from Text assuming the default format of date and time. Returns Just time if successful, Nothing otherwise.

methods.name: parse
methods.documentation: Parse Time from Text. Returns a Time object and throws an error if unable to parse the time.

methods.name: timeZone
methods.documentation: Returns the timezone associated with this Time.

methods.name: now
methods.documentation: Gets the current time in the users timezone. Usage: Time.now.

methods.name: timeOfDay
methods.documentation: Gets time of day (hours, minutes, seconds) as a TimeOfDay instance.

methods.name: setTimeOfDay
methods.documentation: Sets the time-of-day part of this Time to a given TimeOfDay instance.

methods.name: setTimeZone
methods.documentation: Sets the timezone of this time to a given TimeZone instance.

methods.name: addDays
methods.documentation: Advances the date by a given number of days.

methods.name: subDays
methods.documentation: Subtracts a given number of days from the date.

methods.name: beginningOfDay
methods.documentation:
Gets the beginning of the current day.
 If called on February 14th at 4:00, it will return February 14th 0:00

methods.name: endOfDay
methods.documentation:
Gets the end of the current day.
 If called on February 14th at 4:00, it will return February 15th 0:00

methods.name: timeOfYear
methods.documentation: Gets the time of year in form of a tuple: (year, month, day)

methods.name: fromTimeOfYear
methods.documentation: Creates a Time object from its parameters: the year, month and day and an optional TimeZone..

methods.name: beginningOfMonth
methods.documentation: Gets the Time representing the first day of the current month.

methods.name: endOfMonth
methods.documentation: Gets the Time representing the last day of the current month.

methods.name: beginningOfYear
methods.documentation: Gets the Time representing the first day (January 1st) of the current year.

methods.name: endOfYear
methods.documentation: Gets the Time representing the last day (December 31st) of the current year.

methods.name: toUTC
methods.documentation: Converts this Time instance to a UTCTime.

methods.name: diff
methods.documentation: Calculate difference between to time values.

methods.name: add
methods.documentation: Add a TimeInterval to this Time.

methods.name: sub
methods.documentation: Subtract a TimeInterval from this Time.

methods.name: defaultFormat
methods.documentation: Default format for Time: YYYY-MM-DD.HH:MM:SS+TTTT. The TTTT in the format above stands for the timezone offset.

methods.name: safeParseFmt
methods.documentation: Tries to parse Time from Text using the specified format. Returns Just time if successful and Nothing otherwise. In most cases, you can use safeParse, which uses the default format. If a custom format is needed, please see: https://hackage.haskell.org/package/time-1.8.0.3/docs/Data-Time-Format.html#v:formatTime

methods.name: parseFmt
methods.documentation: Parse Time from Text using the supplied format. Returns a Time object and throws an error if unable to parse the time. In most cases, you can use parse, which uses the default format. If a custom format is needed, please see: https://hackage.haskell.org/package/time-1.8.0.3/docs/Data-Time-Format.html#v:formatTime

methods.name: format
methods.documentation: Formats a Time according to the specifier supplied (converting to Text). If a custom format is needed, please see: https://hackage.haskell.org/package/time-1.8.0.3/docs/Data-Time-Format.html#v:formatTime

methods.name: fromEpoch
methods.documentation: Parses a Time from a number representing the standard epoch.

methods.name: toEpoch
methods.documentation: Converts a Time to an epoch.

classes.name: Time
classes.documentation: A class representing time (and date), with timezone. By default it will use the current timezone as set on the user's machine. If you wish to override that behaviour, you can explicitly set the timezone with setTimeZone, like: Time.now . setTimeZone TimeZone.cst Time supports various formatting and parsing methods, including the default toText method, format (accepting a format string), toEpoch, parse, parseFmt (for custom formats) and fromEpoch. Time instances can be compared and you can add and subtract TimeIntervals, like: Time.now . add 2.minutes The above can also be expressed in a more natural syntax with: 2.minutes.fromNow Additional helper methods exist to make working with Time easier, please consult the docstring for each method for further information.

methods.documentation: Is the offset of this TimeZone the same as of the other one?

methods.name: current
methods.documentation: Returns the TimeZone object representing the current timezone.

methods.name: minutes
methods.documentation: The offset (in minutes) from the UTC timezone.

methods.name: create
methods.documentation: Creates a new TimeZoneInstance.

methods.name: summerOnly
methods.documentation: Is this timezone valid only throughout the summertime?

methods.name: name
methods.documentation: The three letter shortcut name for this timezone, can be blank.

methods.name: fromMinutes
methods.documentation: Creates a nameless timezone with a given offset (in minutes).

methods.name: fromHours
methods.documentation: Creates a nameless timezone with a given offset (in hours).

classes.name: TimeZone
classes.documentation:
A class representing the time zone.
 Please keep in mind that the offset is in minutes, as some timezones
 use the multiple of 15 minutes as the offset.

methods.name: <
methods.documentation: Does this TimeOfDay point to an earlier time during the day than the other?
Is this TimeOfDay equal to the other? (Up to one second resolution).
Does this TimeOfDay point to a later time during the day than the other?

classes.name: TimeOfDay
classes.documentation: A class representing the time of day (hours, minutes, seconds).

methods.name: <
methods.documentation: Is this UTCTime earlier than the other?
Does this and the other UTCTime point to the same time?
Is this UTCTime later than the other?

methods.name: toText
methods.documentation: Converts a Time to Text using the default format (YYYY-MM-DD.HH:MM:SS).

methods.name: diff
methods.documentation: Calculate difference between two time values.

methods.name: add
methods.documentation: Add a TimeInterval to this UTCTime.

methods.name: sub
methods.documentation: Subtract a TimeInterval from this UTCTime.

methods.name: defaultFormat
methods.documentation: Default format for UTCTime: YYYY-MM-DD.HH:MM:SS.

methods.name: format
methods.documentation: Formats a Time according to the specifier supplied (converting to Text). If a custom format is needed, please see: https://hackage.haskell.org/package/time-1.8.0.3/docs/Data-Time-Format.html#v:formatTime

methods.name: toZonedTime
methods.documentation: Converts this UTCTime instance to a Time, using the local timezone.

classes.name: UTCTime
classes.documentation: A class representing the UTC time (mostly to facilitate other computations). For the majority of use-cases it is recommended to use the Time class, which supports timezones and provides a much richer API. However, for frequent operations involving time differences and arithmetic operations, this class will provide slightly better performance.

methods.documentation: Are this and the other TimeIntervals the same?

methods.name: toReal
methods.documentation: Return a real representing the number of picoseconds in this TimeInterval.

methods.name: toSeconds
methods.documentation: Return the number of seconds in this interval.

methods.name: toMiliseconds
methods.documentation: Return the number of miliseconds in this interval.

methods.name: toMicroseconds
methods.documentation: Return the number of microseconds in this interval.

methods.name: before
methods.documentation: Subtract this TimeInterval from a given Time, hence returning a point in time before the given Time.

methods.name: from
methods.documentation: Add this TimeInterval to a given Time, hence returning a point in time some TimeInterval from the given Time.

methods.name: ago
methods.documentation: Return this TimeInterval before now (so some amount of time ago).

methods.name: fromNow
methods.documentation: Return this TimeInterval after now (so some amount of time from now).

classes.name: TimeInterval
classes.documentation: A class representing time intervals, that is: a difference between two times. Can be converted to different time resolutions like seconds, miliseconds and microseconds. Internally the time interval is stored with picosecond resolution. The main purpose of this class is to make working with time intuitive: using the helper methods you can write things like: 5.seconds.ago 10.minutes.fromNow 15.seconds.before someTime 20.minutes.after someTime

methods.name: path
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: create
methods.documentation: A method actually connecting to the socket.

methods.name: port
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: secure
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: host
methods.documentation: Field getter.

methods.name: setHost
methods.documentation: Sets the host part of the url to connect to.

methods.name: setPath
methods.documentation: Sets the path part of the url to connect to.

methods.name: setPort
methods.documentation: Specifies the port to which to connect.

methods.name: setSecure
methods.documentation:
Used for explicitly making the connection secure.
 Note that in the majority of use cases this will be deduced from
 the url, hence rendering the usage of this method unnecessary.

classes.name: WebSocketInstance
classes.documentation: A class used for creating new WSConnection instances, hence making the connections over web sockets. Please note that it is advisable to use the WebSocket.connection method rather than to create new connections instead of instantiating this class directly. On the other hand, the setters of this class are used well with the helper method. Please see the documentation for WebSocket.

methods.name: stream
methods.documentation: Tap into the WebSocket, creating a Stream of Binary blobs. Please see the documentation for Stream in Std.Base for information on how to process streams in Luna.

methods.name: read
methods.documentation: Read from the WebSocket. Returns a Binary blob that can later be converted to any data type necessary.

methods.name: write
methods.documentation: Send textual data over the WebSocket connection. Can be given anything that is convertable to Text (exposing a toText method).

methods.name: close
methods.documentation: Close the WebSocket connection after it is no longer needed.

methods.name: writeBinary
methods.documentation: Send binary data over the WebSocket connection. Can be given anything that is convertable to Binary (exposing a toBinary method).

classes.name: WSConnection
classes.documentation: A class representing the WebSocket connection. This is the handle you are given after you create a WebSocket connection with WebSocket.connection. It allows you to read and write to the WebSocket and close it after it is no longer needed.

methods.name: sendToAll
methods.documentation: Send a textual message to all of the connected clients. The message may be of any type exposing a toText method.

methods.name: sendBinaryToAll
methods.documentation: Send a binary message to all of the connected clients. The message may be of any type exposing a toBinary method.

methods.name: nextMessage
methods.documentation: Helper method that reads the next message that has arrived to the server.

methods.name: messageStream
methods.documentation: Taps into the stream of incoming messages, returning a Stream of Binary blobs. Please see the documentation for Stream in Std.Base for information on how to process streams in Luna.

classes.name: WSServer
classes.documentation: A simple broadcast WebSocket server. Allows you to send messages to all of the connected clients at once. Note that you should use the WebSocket.server helper method to create instances of this class. Refer to the documentation of the WebSocket class for more information.

methods.name: connection
methods.documentation: Connect to the WebSocket at given address (the host param). You must call create on the object created by this method to actually make the connection. The host may or may not contain the ws or wss specifier. If wss is specified, the connection will be assumed to be secure and the port will be set to 443. For ws connections the default port is 80. If you wish to create a secure connection but leave out the wss part of the url, you must explicitly call setSecure to override the defaults. Example usage: conn = WebSocket.connection "ws://somehost.com/sockets" . setPort 12345 . create stream = conn.stream # process the incoming stream... conn.close

methods.name: server
methods.documentation: Create a simple, broadcast server that recieves messages from its clients and can send messages to all of the clients at once. you need to specify what will be the address (host) of the server and on which port it will be accepting the connections (port). Once you create it, you can call all of the WSServer methods on the returned server instance. Example usage: server = WebSocket.server "somehost" 55555 server.sendToAll "hello, clients" responseStream = server.messageStream

classes.name: WebSocket
classes.documentation: The main class for dealing with WebSockets. Supports creating client-side connections (with connect) and servers (with server).
